channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: My Value Creation Journey
item.description: Bartley J. Madden has produced a book that challenges business leaders and investment professionals to think outside the box systematically to solve difficult problems.

item.title: Bill Gates says he's ready to plow billions into a next-gen nuclear plant being built by his startup
item.description: “I put in over a billion, and I’ll put in billions more,” said Gates.

item.title: Private Markets’ Governance: A New Era
item.description: Now that the SEC Private Fund Adviser rules have been struck down, it's incumbent on the industry to demonstrate how private ordering can work.

item.title: Top Wall Street bear surrenders to bull market and flips forecast, now seeing the S&P 500 soaring to 6,000 by year-end
item.description: "Today, GenAI’s potential in every job and sector is inflecting. The backdrop of slowing inflation, a Fed intent on cutting rates and growth support Goldilocks.”

item.title: The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
item.description: What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

item.title: Electricity prices in France turn negative as renewable energy floods the grid
item.description: French day-ahead power fell to -€5.76 a megawatt-hour, the lowest in four years, in an auction on Epex Spot.

item.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
item.description: Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

item.title: $155 million debut for 'Inside Out 2' is biggest since 'Barbie' and second best ever for Disney's Pixar
item.description: The success is significant for Pixar, marking a much-needed return to form for a studio that has had a string of underwhelming launches.

item.title: FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette
item.description: The theories and models introduced by Robert Shiller and Didier Sornette are as applicable to the foreign exchange market as they are to the stock market.

item.title: Gen X is the least confident about retirement as 'crunch time' nears—and has done less to prepare than boomers or millennials
item.description: "Gen Xers are reaching crunch time for retirement planning. For Gen Xers, retirement is no longer this far off idea."
